required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Enzyme Activity of Matrix Metalloproteinases in the Serum of Patients With Malignant Obstructive Hyperbilirubinemia Before and After PTBD
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Percutaneous Biliary Drainage on the Change of Enzyme Activity of Matrix Metalloproteinases in the Serum of Patients With Malignant Obstructive Hyperbilirubinemia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to detect differences in the enzymatic activity of matrix metalloproteinases in patients with malignant obstructive hyperbilirubinemia before and after percutaneous biliary drainage.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will be designed as a prospective cohort study involving the collection of peripheral blood samples before and one month after percutaneous biliary drainage for further molecular biochemical analysis (measurement of serum matrix metalloproteinase activity). Biochemical analyzes are preceded by the entry of data relevant to the research (demographic, anamnestic, clinical and biochemical).

primary_outcome.description: MMP serume activity will be measured by molecular biochemical analysis performed on peripheral blood samples taken before and one month after percutaneous biliary drainage

arm_group.description: Value of serum matrix metalloproteinase activity before and one month after PTBD

intervention.description: Collection of peripheral blood samples before and one month after percutaneous biliary drainage performed for patients with malignant obstructive hyperbilirubinemia for further molecular biochemical analysis (measurement of serum matrix metalloproteinase activity).

study_pop.textblock: Patients with malignant obstructive hyperbilirubinemia admitted to hospital and referred to the interventional radiologist for percutaneous biliary drainage.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
pathological confirmation or imaging data confirming malignant disease causing bile duct obstruction, performance status 0-1
Exclusion Criteria:
terminally ill patients, performance status >2, hepatic decompensation, severe underlying cardiac or renal diseases and coagulation disorders.

overall_official.affiliation: Institute for chemistry in medicine, Medical school, University of Belgrade
